**流星锤**（morning star）是[NetHack](/index.php?title=NetHack/zh-CN\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "NetHack/zh-CN (page does not exist)")中的一种单手[武器](/wiki/%E6%AD%A6%E5%99%A8 "武器")。它由[铁](/index.php?title=%E9%93%81\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "铁 (page does not exist)")制成。

[巨魔杀手](/index.php?title=%E5%B7%A8%E9%AD%94%E6%9D%80%E6%89%8B\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "巨魔杀手 (page does not exist)")是一种[神器](/index.php?title=%E7%A5%9E%E5%99%A8%E6%AD%A6%E5%99%A8\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "神器武器 (page does not exist)")类流星锤。

[ ]

## 生成

流星锤在随机生成武器中占比1.2%。

所有[玩家怪物](/index.php?title=%E7%8E%A9%E5%AE%B6%E6%80%AA%E7%89%A9\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "玩家怪物 (page does not exist)")在生成时有3⁄290（约1.03%）的概率尝试获取流星锤。如果巨魔杀手尚未在游戏中生成，该流星锤有1⁄2的概率会是巨魔杀手。

## 流星锤技能

| 流星锤  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| ---- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| 最大等级 | [角色](/index.php?title=%E8%A7%92%E8%89%B2\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "角色 (page does not exist)")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| 基础   | - [穴居人](/index.php?title=%E7%A9%B4%E5%B1%85%E4%BA%BA\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "穴居人 (page does not exist)")、[盗贼](/index.php?title=%E7%9B%97%E8%B4%BC\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "盗贼 (page does not exist)")、[游侠](/index.php?title=%E6%B8%B8%E4%BE%A0\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "游侠 (page does not exist)")、[游客](/index.php?title=%E6%B8%B8%E5%AE%A2\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "游客 (page does not exist)") |
| 熟练   | * [野蛮人](/index.php?title=%E9%87%8E%E8%9B%AE%E4%BA%BA\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "野蛮人 (page does not exist)")、[骑士](/index.php?title=%E9%AA%91%E5%A3%AB\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "骑士 (page does not exist)")                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| 老练   | - [牧师](/index.php?title=%E7%89%A7%E5%B8%88\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "牧师 (page does not exist)")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |

流星锤是游戏中唯一使用流星锤[技能](/index.php?title=%E6%8A%80%E8%83%BD\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "技能 (page does not exist)")的武器。

## 策略

流星锤对小型怪物的伤害不错，但是对大型怪物的伤害并不算高，而且非常重（120 [aum](/index.php?title=Aum/zh-CN\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Aum/zh-CN (page does not exist)")），因此并不值得投入技能点去锻炼。拥有流星锤技能的职业一般都有更好的武器选项，比如说野蛮人可以使用[战斧](/wiki/%E6%88%98%E6%96%A7 "战斧")，骑士可以使用[长剑](/wiki/%E9%95%BF%E5%89%91 "长剑")，盗贼可以使用[匕首](/wiki/%E5%8C%95%E9%A6%96 "匕首")，等等。[链棒](/wiki/%E9%93%BE%E6%A3%92 "链棒")因为有远程攻击的能力，实用性也比流星锤强。

## 历史

流星锤最初于[NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d")加入游戏。

## 起源

[![维基百科](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "维基百科")

[维基百科](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/zh:Main_Page "wikipedia:zh:Main Page")相关条目：

***[Morning star (weapon)](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morning_star_\(weapon\) "wikipedia:Morning star (weapon)")***

流星锤是一种中世纪武器，一般有木制的握柄，一端附有带刺的铁块。流星锤于14世纪初开始在德国等地被广泛使用，其在德语中被称作“Morgenstern”。流星锤在步兵和骑兵中均有使用，骑兵使用的流星锤的握柄一般更短。现存的流星锤一般是双手持握，长约6英尺。

人们常常将流星锤与[权杖](/wiki/%E6%9D%83%E6%9D%96 "权杖")混淆，事实上，权杖的攻击部一般是凸缘或铁球，而不是带刺的球，且权杖一般完全由金属制成。

## Variants

**此条目或段落的部分内容需要翻译。**  
您可以帮助我们[**翻译此页面**](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Morning_star/zh-CN\&action=edit)，但**请勿使用机器翻译**。

Variants with [object material](/wiki/Object_material "Object material") systems may make morning stars somewhat more appealing if discovered early on with a lighter material. Some variants add more weapons that use the morning star skill.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), the morning star deals 2d6 damage to small monsters and 1d8+1 to large monsters, and its weight is reduced to 80 aum.

[Iris](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\)#Iris.2C_Friend_from_Afar "Spirits (dNetHack)") is a [spirit](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") that grants skill in morning stars while bound.

There are two artifact new morning stars, in addition to [Trollsbane](/wiki/Trollsbane "Trollsbane"):

- [Bloodletter](/wiki/Bloodletter "Bloodletter") is an unaligned artifact that has several blood-related effects.
- [The Ruinous Descent of Stars](/wiki/The_Ruinous_Descent_of_Stars "The Ruinous Descent of Stars") is a chaotic [intelligent artifact](/wiki/Intelligent_artifact "Intelligent artifact") that favors [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)") and is made of [silvered](/wiki/Silver "Silver") [metal](/wiki/Metal "Metal"), and acts as the chaotic [crowning](/wiki/Crowning "Crowning") gift for hedrow [Nobles](/wiki/Noble "Noble") and drow [Healers](/wiki/Healer "Healer").

### notdNetHack

In [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), in addition to dNetHack details, Iris generates with a +7 morning star that has the [psionic](/index.php?title=Psionic\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Psionic (page does not exist)") [object property](/wiki/Object_property "Object property") when summoned by an [Illithanachronounbinder](/wiki/Illithanachronounbinder "Illithanachronounbinder").

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") merges the morning star skill into the [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace") skill and adds the [orcish morning star](/wiki/Orcish_morning_star "Orcish morning star"), an [orcish](/wiki/Orcish "Orcish") variant of the weapon.

[Dwarven](/wiki/Racial_monster "Racial monster") [sergeants](/wiki/Sergeant "Sergeant") have a 1⁄2 chance of generating with a morning star, and [gnolls](/wiki/Gnoll_\(EvilHack\) "Gnoll (EvilHack)"), [gnoll hunters](/wiki/Gnoll_hunter "Gnoll hunter") and [flinds](/wiki/Flind_\(EvilHack\) "Flind (EvilHack)") have a 2⁄3 chance of generating with one. The [Paladin](/wiki/Paladin_\(monster\) "Paladin (monster)") is always generated with a morning star of an enchantment between +3 and +5; [Lucifer](/wiki/Lucifer "Lucifer") is always generated with a morning star that has the fire [object property](/wiki/Object_property "Object property").

A morning star can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a dagger and a mace. Morning stars can be used to create a couple of items:

- A morning star can be combined with a mace to create a flail.
- A morning star can be combined with [barding](/wiki/Barding_\(item\) "Barding (item)") to make [spiked barding](/wiki/Spiked_barding "Spiked barding").

## 百科文本

The morning star was a medieval weapon resembling a mace, but  
with a large spike on the end and smaller spikes around the  
circumference. It was also known as the goedendag (from the  
Dutch word for "good day") and the holy water sprinkler (from  
its resemblance to the aspergillum sometimes used in the  
Catholic Mass). It was used by both cavalry and infantry;  
the horseman's weapon typically had a shorter haft than the  
footman's, which might be up to six feet long. It came into  
use in the beginning of the 14th century.  
The name "morning star" is often erroneously applied to the  
military flail (also known as the therscol), a similar weapon,  
but with the head attached by a short chain.

\[ Dictionary of Medieval Knighthood and Chivalry,  
 by Bradford Broughton ]
